name: Content page schema (reference)
description: Structure used by APIM content pages in this wizard. Use it to add consistent, client-ready guidance.
summary: Keep pages decision-oriented: what to choose, why it matters, how to configure in the portal, how to validate, and common pitfalls.
Use links to primary documentation and connect to relevant policy templates in the policy library.
Prefer concise checklists and validation steps that can be reused during client engagements.

terms.definition: What choice the reader must make (example: public vs private access, subscription keys vs JWT).
How the choice impacts security, reliability, operations, cost, and developer experience.
Concrete portal-first steps to implement the configuration.
How to verify configuration works (tests, logs, traffic checks, failure-mode tests).
Common mistakes, edge cases, and operational hazards.
Primary sources (Microsoft Learn and the APIM resources hub).

exampleSkeleton.name: Example page title
exampleSkeleton.decision: Describe the decision in one sentence

nextSteps: When adding new pages, follow this schema and keep checklists actionable.
Always include at least one validation step that can be executed during a client rollout.
